body.head.byline: By VIVIAN S. TOY; With Valerie Cotsalas, Suzanne Hamlin and Lisa Prevost

abstract.p: Sampling of housing on market in New York City metropolitan area; photos (M)

block.p: Woodland Contemporary $1,895,000
NASSAU COUNTY: 41 Valley Road, Old Westbury

A five-bedroom, three-and-a-half-bath house on two acres surrounded by hiking trails owned by the State University of New York at Old Westbury. Centered in the living room is a stone wall housing a chimney with dual-sided fireplace. Michael Piccolo, Daniel Gale Sotheby's International Realty (516) 376-2926; www.danielgale.com
TAXES: $32,468 a year
PROS: The master bedroom on the first floor, with sliding doors to a deck, also has a dressing room, two walk-in closets and a full bath with Jacuzzi and walk-in shower.
CONS: The kitchen cabinets and appliances are out of date.
Upper West Side Co-op $1,475,000
MANHATTAN: 126 West 80th Street (between Amsterdam and Columbus Aves.), #3
A two-bedroom, two-bath brownstone apartment with a washer and dryer.
Reginald Fairchild, Sotheby's International Realty (212) 606-7771; www.siroffices.com
MAINTENANCE: $1,021 a month

PROS: This floor-through co-op has been elegantly renovated, with careful attention to the original fireplace and dark wood details. The kitchen comes with Sub-Zero and Wolf appliances. The master bedroom has a walk-in closet and three windows that overlook the tree-lined street.
CONS: The second bedroom is on the small side.
Brookfield Modern $695,000
CONNECTICUT: 21 North Beech Tree Road, Brookfield

A midcentury modern with four bedrooms, two and a half baths, two fireplaces, a family room, an updated kitchen, a large screened porch and a two-car attached garage. The house, set on two acres, wraps around a central courtyard. Clive Milton (owner), (203) 740-7025; navars43662@mypack.net
TAXES: $7,300 a year
PROS: The house covers 2,400 square feet, and the partly finished basement is the same size. The central living area has 14-foot ceilings.
CONS: The oak floors need refinishing.
Village Co-op $895,000
MANHATTAN: 808 Broadway (at 11th Street), #3N
A one-bedroom, one-bath loft in a doorman building. Abigail Agranat, Prudential Douglas Elliman (212) 206-2802; www.elliman.com
MAINTENANCE: $1,201 a month
PROS: This corner apartment's large windows provide charming city views. The bedroom has a Murphy bed and sliding walls that can be used to divide the room into two small bedrooms.
CONS: The kitchen cabinets and counter could use updating.
South Midwood Victorian $1,600,000
BROOKLYN: 555 East 23rd Street (near Farragut Road)

A six-bedroom frame house with three full baths and two half baths on a double lot with a detached two-car garage. Marc Garstein, Warren Lewis Realty (718) 638-6500; www.warrenlewis.com. Open House Sunday, 2:30 to 4:30 p.m.
TAXES: $4,906 a year
PROS: In an established neighborhood near Brooklyn College, this commodious house with spectacular grounds has been featured for the last eight years on Flatbush's Victorian House and Garden Tour.
CONS: The pool, pond and mini-orchard require a good bit of maintenance.
